meanings.sent1: She decided to skiddoo from the boring party early.
meanings.sent2: He always skiddoos out of work right at 5 o'clock.
meanings.sent3: The cat saw the vacuum cleaner and skiddooed under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The students skiddooed out of the classroom as soon as the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The thief tried to skiddoo from the scene before the police arrived.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to dismiss or reject something.
meanings.sent1: Skiddoo! I don't want to hear any more excuses.
meanings.sent2: Skiddoo, I have no interest in your proposal.
meanings.sent3: Skiddoo! That idea is as silly as a clown on a unicycle.
meanings.sent4: When he heard the news, he shouted 'Skiddoo!' and walked away.
meanings.sent5: Skiddoo! Your lies are as transparent as a glass window.
